description: Fasting (Sawm) is the fourth pillar of Islam. It involves abstaining from food, drink, sexual relations, and sinful behavior from dawn (Fajr) until sunset (Maghrib) during the month of Ramadan. It is an act of worship, self-discipline, and spiritual reflection.

importance.text: O you who have believed, decreed upon you is fasting as it was decreed upon those before you that you may become righteous.
The month of Ramadan [is that] in which was revealed the Qurâ€™an, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion.

obligatory: Qada fasts (making up missed Ramadan fasts)
voluntary: Six days of Shawwal after Ramadan

conditions: Abstaining from anything that breaks the fast
things_that_break_fast: Taking injections that nourish the body (e.g. glucose IVs)
exemptions: Pregnant or breastfeeding women (if fasting harms them or the baby)
Travelers (with option to make it up later)
Menstruating or postpartum women (must make up later)

hadiths.text: Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and seeking reward, his past sins will be forgiven.
Fasting is a shield. So the person observing fasting should avoid obscene speech and ignorant behavior.

benefits: Encourages Qur'an recitation and good deeds
recommended_etiquettes: Break the fast immediately after Maghrib with dates and water
Avoid idle talk, anger, and sins
Increase in Duas, charity, and Qur'an recitation
